page.title: 15VICTORIA PARK,HACKNEY
page.content: Victoria park is the largest park in Hackney,it has two parks.It runs along Regents canal for quite a bit,and they have festivals and fairs there. There is a large area which is fenced off for Reindeer.There are lakes which you used to be able to sail boats,but you can't anymore.You can go fishing.There are ducks,and squirrels live in the trees & running through the park,there is a road which cars can go on,it's not at all busy,joggers jog and bikers ride down the middle.There's a place where rabbits and guinea-pigs are kept and there's a swing park with a round about,a slide, swings, a sandpit and some American swings.There's lots of woody places & a garden with flowers in shapes & patterns.The tennis courts are at the end and next to that another swing park similar to the other
